intro: Orostachys minuta f. alba, commonly known as the white-flowered orostachys, is a succulent plant native to arid regions of Asia. It features small, fleshy leaves that are typically blue-gray in color, adapted to store water. The plant produces delicate, white flowers that bloom in early summer, adding a subtle beauty to its appearance. It thrives in well-draining soil and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens or xeriscaping. Its compact size and ornamental flowers make it a popular choice for drought-tolerant landscaping.
